page.title: 02Monmouth and the Wye Valley
page.content: Our area is the gateway to the{Wye {Valley }and attracts many visitors from home and abroad.{Tourists find Monmouth a useful centre for exploring the{scenery,}the numerous{historical sites,}fishing, and other river pastimes. Fewer people stay in {hotels}in Monmouth. There are moves to close another hotel, leaving only one hotel proper in the town. However, the {camping}and{caravan sites}are thriving.The caravan site at Mitchel Troy is very popular, especially, it seems, with tourists from London.So too are Guest-Houses which provide cheaper{accommodation. There is a{tourist information centre and{National Trust shop} in the town.
